alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 2:02PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henry County in southeastern Alabama, southeastern Clay, western Calhoun and northern Early Counties in southwestern Georgia through 245 PM EDT/145 PM CDT/... At 201 PM EDT/101 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Columbia, or 11 miles west of Blakely, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Blakely, Edison, Arlington, Douglasville, Haleburg, Bluffton, Harrisons Mill, Barnes, Tumbleton, Parksville, Hardwickburg, Grandberry Crossroads, Hayes, Colomokee, Commissary Hill, Turman, Miller, Ferrell Crossroads, Early Co A/p and Kolomoki Mounds Sp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT/500 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia.
